turn.1: What is the difference between a step sequence and a regular sequence?
turn.2: Step sequence A step sequence is an element in figure skating.
turn.4: It is a sequence of steps or moves in the field in a prescribed pattern across the ice.
turn.6: The pattern of the step sequences may be a straight line, circular, or serpentine.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: In ice dancing, step sequences may be skated either "in hold" or "not touching", with the terms referring to the sequence being performed while in a dance hold or with the dancers not touching each other, respectively.
turn.10: Step sequences are required elements in competitive programs in single skating, pair skating, and ice dancing.
turn.11: What do you find to be the most interesting fact?
turn.12: They vary in difficulty from level one (least difficult) to level four (most difficult).
